document_data.mainbody:
The Windride was a sacred ritual performed by followers of Shaundakul, the Rider of the Winds.
The Windride was celebrated on Tarsakh 15. Regardless of their current location, priests of Shaundakul were required to face a strong wind and cast wind walk and wraithform at dawn on this day. The magic of the spells was enchanced to last from dawn until dusk. The priest would spend the day soaring high with the wind to honor their god.
